title: When a bronze player gets too full of himself, sometimes you gotta shut them down...
body:
http://imgur.com/gallery/CoR0zfa

EDIT: Don't take this post seriously please :D. 
It's just a joke I didn't mean anything by it :(  
sorry if I offended anyone :/

replies.body:
Even though I am bronze I like to do this to people who get lucky in placements and place silver 3 or 4... 

So obviously they think they're better than any bronze and rub it in your face.  Like they get really obnoxious. 

Then you gotta teach them it's not till about silver 2 or up that your actually good. 

Reason being it's hard to place silver 2 in placements you'd have to win most of them to even get that.  

#so most people who are Silver 2, probably climbed there and perhaps have the skills to get to gold sooner or later.. 

but's it's annoying when someone brags about being higher elo...

Silvers may be a little more skilled than bronze, but... not by much.. 
____________________________________

I beat a few golds before but they either weren't trying or were tiling HARD or something..... I have one of my friends list. I might try to 1v1 them as a way for them to beat me back in a more fair environment.  (They had a troll support, can't call that a fair win) 

but after that game we Qued together for some normals and we help ger her rank 5 mastery with vayne.   She's pretty chill. 
________________________________

In short. It's annoying having someone who's just a short division above you bragging about their skill.. 

But I know to respect those of higher elo... So long as you don't be a jerk about it.  Respect me, ill respect you.  Fair trade? Awesome.

Everyone who plays the game sucks.

It's just a matter of degrees.
When i was silver i thought golds were good at the game. Now im thinking maybe people stop being terrible in mastertier maybe.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=bAgc0cZF,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2015-12-30T00:23:37.847+0000)
>
> Everyone who plays the game sucks.
> 
> It's just a matter of degrees.

I can confirm that.

I climbed from mid bronze to gold, they all suck. I still suck at this game, but I just had too much time on my hands.

And there is nothing worse than jerk higher ranked players who act like they are better human beings for wasting more of their time than you.

I know I suck, I just don't care to climb, I play for fun in normals.. 

Malz jungle? Why not, let's try it! WOW IT'S SURPRISINGLY OP!
Same here, I literally just played Rank to get in a division to shut my other friends up. I've sat at S2 for like 4 months now because I really can't bring myself to go through that toxic cesspool.
Akali jung is really fun!
im s1 and counting and im still garbage

Nice! but you have some skill to be S1.  I wish you best of luck to get to gold and stay there for season rewards next  season. 

have a happy new year in 2016!

As someone who has climbed from Bronze to Diamond 3(higest i've ever been) on multiple accounts, stopped playing and settled around Plat 4 tier of play. Let me tell you that improving yourself, focusing on your own play and learning from people you find exceptional players instead of whining about them beating you due to "OP champ" or "luck" or "bad teams" is the best thing you can do to climb. Keeping an open mind will take you very far, accepting your mistakes will take you even further. I used to think I was good in Bronze but it was just my team holding me back. Then there came a point I was looking back at how I used to play the game back when I was Bronze, Silver and I would laugh at how dumb I was. 

TL DR: Rank is important but if you constantly keep thinking you're good you will never be a better player. There is always someone better than you, it's when you accept that fact and try learning from people rather than being upset at how they are better than you and making excuses is when you will really fly off.

Its not that I think im good. I jnow im bad. Its when others of my elo think theyre the best  that they shouldny be bronze or silver that they diserve higher. Simetimes they need to be beaten by someone lower than they are to really puch them in the face as a wake up call saying.. 

"This IS your elo"
____________

I honestly love being bronze. Dont get me wrong I wanna improve. But I dont wanna raise my elo.  Its hard to explain. 

But its fun being in an elo where anything is possible as long as your decent enough. Like I do kennen adc and wreck every vayne that comes bot. I pulled off annie adc once. And ,1v1ed a mundo as a tank heimer.  But none of them work that great to be meta. 

High elos you probably cant do that as they know better.

Anything is possible in high elo too, you just have to be mature enough to get by the abuse of playing off meta and really accepting when you do play poorly and needed to improve, There is players like "scrumm" who play Talon only every lane. Even Talon Support and he's Challenger 1

Yea ink if I can do that. I enjoy the 3 yordle girls. But I like to try other things out. 

I seem to play alto of teemo.  Wish I didn't. Aha

Currently learning ezreal.  His ultimate is hard to land, but nothing I can't keep trying to learn. Its funny to joke ppl in a rough spot with.. E then flash. Then e again.. Over 3 walls.  Get out safe. 

Trying deathfire on different champions who may be able to take it. 

Like Kenny I was surprised to see it procked off his w passive.  His q and w actives. E I use as an escape or engage. And cult may be an ape but it does tons of damage and stuns.

Couldnt agree with this more. Also, find time to slow down and look at the big picture. Once you get used to it there are so many patterns on the minimap, whos gonna go where and who you can catch, that awareness is invaluable but for the longest time i was distracted by more immediate stuff.

I've had a Plat V Master Yi suck and feed hard. He kept going in alone. People get lucky even further than silver. The fact that he got matched up with me, a silver, means this peron has terrible MMR for his/her elo.

The mmr thing isn't necessarily true. If that was ranked, yes, but in normals it tends to throw plats and diamonds against silver and golds just for the speed of matchmaking because there's not that many of that Elo players in normals compared to silvers and golds

> [{quoted}](name=Robbit Mang,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=bAgc0cZF,comment-id=000000030000,timestamp=2015-12-30T17:07:39.485+0000)
>

Maybe you're right, I honestly don't know exactly how league's MMR works. My point, to the comment I originally replied to, is that Silver 2 and up players aren't necessarily "good". I mean people call silver bronze 2.0 for a reason. :P

Meh, the whole respecting higher elos is pretty bs. 

Sure, a diamond is a better at the game then you, but its just a game, they don't have to be arrogant, a lot of people actually do have a really bad superiority complex when it comes to this game. They believe simply because of a bit of skill in the game (probably brought on more by experience rather than natural talent) makes them smarter, makes them better. It's ridiculously immature.

You should respect someone who gives you respect. What impresses me is when someone is ridiculously good at the game, but still laughs at their own mistakes, admits others good calls over their own. And takes the failure of others not as a chance to brag or ridicule,  but as a chance to teach them. That's truly impressive. That's what diamond and above should mean, otherwise all you are is a rager who spent the last few years on a keyboard and learnt some muscle memory.

What yoi said in you first sentance is somewhat what I mean. 

Sorta the golden rule. 

"Treat others how you want to be treated."

It's not just silver to bronze, I've seen tons of plat players talk down to me and other gold or silver players and then get their faces stomped on in lane and flame their jungler for not ganking. When are they going to understand that being a higher rank than the rest of your team does **not** make you the best player on the team, nor does it give you the authority to talk shit to your teammates just because things aren't going your way?
Plot Twist: Loki is the Plat and Hulk is the Bronzie
My bronze friend thought he could do this too... until I actually put him in his place... with a champion I never play

"put him in his place"

Uhh.... O_o

That's... That's a bit much...
If you wanna talk smack there is no mercy.
Jarvan 4th vs Dr Mundo
More like when a diamond elo player gets 1v1ed by an unranked.

I'm S1 and the enemy team had a toxic D5 Karthus Mid player. I played AP Lucian into the Karthus and ended up stomping him going like 10-0. It's enjoyable to put higher elo players in their place and prove that playing in low elo doesn't inherently make you a bad player.

I climbed from silver II to gold V in like 8 months of playing this game. I haven't seen bronze, however I do sometimes see bronze players who are okay. The thing is, if you're in bronze you're doing SOMETHING wrong. It could be anything. I played against a bronze jinx who outmechaniced my ass and beat me, but then her positioning skills were god awful and he kept pushing mid and dying and lost his lead, and that's probably why he was bronze. Just maybe get someone else to analyze you (who isn't bronze) who can maybe help you out and it'll be easy to gold. Unless you're just bad, which is also possible, in that case just play and you'll improve
This. I like this. Even if I'm Bronze.
